publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3505 Richard Lochhead: UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries-That the Parliament warmly endorses the aims of the UNISON campaign to reduce needlestick injuries in hospitals which, at their worst, can transmit fatal viruses including Hepatitis B and C which result in liver diseases as well as HIV, and calls on the Scottish Executive to introduce "safer needles" throughout the NHS in Scotland in order to protect NHS staff from unnecessary risk.
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Scott Barrie*R, Shona Robison*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-3505 UNISON Campaign on Needlestick Injuries (lodged on 25 October 2002) Elaine Smith*
